potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Monitor for additional symptoms and maintain good hygiene.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: In teenagers, fungal infections can cause skin discolorations like spots in the groin area, especially if there is moisture and warmth.

potential_causes.name_localized: Skin irritation from shaving or clothing
potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Ensure proper skin care and use loose, breathable clothing.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Irritation caused by shaving or friction from tight clothing can lead to skin discoloration or spots in the groin area.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Keep the area dry and wear lightweight, breathable fabrics.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Excessive sweating can cause skin darkening or spots, especially during warm weather or active routines.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Maintain good hygiene and observe if the spot changes over time.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Hormonal fluctuations in teenagers can sometimes cause skin pigmentation changes or spots.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Use protective clothing and keep the area clean after activity.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Repetitive friction from activities like sports can lead to skin spots or pigmentation changes in the groin area.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Maintain regular personal hygiene, especially after sweating or physical activity.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Inadequate cleaning can result in skin issues such as spots or irritation in the groin.

potential_causes.suggestion_localized: Avoid using new soaps, detergents, or lotions in the area.
potential_causes.explanation_localized: Allergic reactions to products applied to the skin can cause spots or pigmentation changes.
